postcards.postcard:
1 Mr./Mrs. Perry Morgan 653 Fairview Ave Westbury NY 11590
Dorthy Murray 419 Valley Wood Drive Salsbury MD 21001
Halloway Hall Bell Tower Salisbury State College
Salisbury Maryland
The center section of Halloway Hall at Salsbury College, including the nobel bell town upon which atop which one can scan the historical city of Salisbury in its entirety, was completed in 1929. Students and townspeople alike are enriched by lyrical sounds emanating from the tower’s Carillon of Bells presented to the College by the Alumni Association on November 5, 1973.
Numeric TBD
Front
2
Numeric TBD
Julia Ward Howe - 1 USA/Margaret Mitchell - 14 USA
Yes
illegible
Salisbury MD
No
Pub. by H.K. Barnett, Allison Park, PA 15101
Dear Cousins: Pleasant having your company. Next time make it longer so we can all get out and explore the peninsula together. Thanks for all the goodies. Am sure you managed to show yourself a good time in Baltimore. Cooled off a mite (degree or 2). Be well, - and love, Dorothy - Murray
August 5
Horizontal

postcard.recipient: Mrs. Audree Perry Wilson Ave Rumford RI
postcard.promomessage: Americhrome Libzig Berlin New York - printed in United States
postcard.publish: Pub. by The Rhode Island News Company, Providence RI

postcard.recipient: Miss Christina Stetina 633 E 224th St 8-A419 Bronx NY
postcard.sender: Ester Manor Executive Office Rt. 17B Monticello NY 12701
postcard.Promomessage: Esther Manor Times Great Vacation News
postcard.personalmessage: Dear Friends It has been a long cold snowy winter for a wonderful change of pace, plan your Ester Manor vacation now – unlimited fun and pleasure for the entire family! Indoor and outdoor swimming, steam rooms, and health club, tennis, handball, golf, baseball, plus top entertainment, dancing and late, late shows await you. The Day Camp is under the alert supervision of trained counsellors. The Teenage Program is better than ever. Hospitality here is as warm and abundant as the rays of the sun. May we suggest that you plan your Esther Manor vacation now? Esther Manor Rt. 17B/ Monticello, NY 12701 Tel. (914) 794-7500 DIRECT WIRE: (212) YU 9-3181 Time to pack your tennis racquet, golf clubs, camera, tanning lotion, swim suits, evening attire, anything else you may want – and your best smile!
postcard.postcardnotes: Returned to sender/ Catskills Institute Northeastern University Library Digital repository

postcard.recipient: Esq. W.H. Caldwell 275 Clinton Ave Brooklyn NY
postcard.pimagetitle: We’re all lit up Let battle commence
postcard.promomessage: This parcel has been presented by important at the request of the authorities do not disclose any particulars of your unit. This parcel is presented through the overseas league and tobacco fund.
postcard.personalmessage: Dir Sir: Many thanks I’ll soon be out of here now, then I shall be lit up! God Bless America and F.D.R.! Yours Sincerely Pte Maynard O.T. S, 6408616
postcard.postcardnotes: Passed P.148 Please write your message to the donor below. Important: At the request of the authorities do not disclose any particulars of your unit. ^^ do not disclose underlined by author. ^^^6.96 handwritten in corner of card

postcard.recipient: Miss Nellie Hall Fern Lodge Pulborough
postcard.pimagetitle: Chicks and Ducklings Who Are You?
postcard.pimagedescription: Do you think you can find a clue for these?
postcard.promomessage: Tuck’s Post Card Chicks and Ducklings Ollette Rapheal Tuck & Sons Regd Postcard 9175
postcard.publish: Raphael Tuck and Sons Oilette Published To Their majesties the king and Queen Regd Postcard 9175
postcard.personalmessage: Dear Nellie Many thanks for PG. Hope you are not all blown away. The weather has been fearful down here. I have been to two balls this week so you can guess I am nearly dead.Love to all.
postcard.postcardnotes: If sent abroad this space may only be used for name and address of sender. For address only. Carte Postale. PostKarte, TPIZ.9

postcard.recipient: The Gomerys 1550 Highland Lane DelRay Beach FL 33444
postcard.sender: Douglas Gomery 4817 Drummond Ave Chevy Chase MD 20815
postcard.pimagedescription: Reading PA 1908. 1939 view, Curt Teish Collection, Lake County (III) Museum. From Ducks and Diners. © 1988 National Trust for Historic Preservation. The Preservation Press.
postcard.personalmessage: What is a WONK? I don’t really know. A kind of expert in numbers. Puddles is better, Marilyn’s ankle is better, but she had an emergency root canal yesterday UGH!
